children.subject: <md>You could certainly look at classes in other departments. Seeing as you are going to be a junior, it is a good time to explore in departments other than CS/DS (can be STEM or not) and experience the variety of offerings available here. I received similar advice at your stage and I certainly do not regret exploring. Since you're already in 2 techs, you can fill the remaining spots in your schedule with these "exploration" units</md>

history.content:
I'll be a junior in the Fall and I'm thinking of taking CS186 and EE126 + a breadth in the fall and thought that taking a third upper division CS course would be a very heavy courseload. 

Originally I was planning on taking Math 53 but not anymore because it doesn't really align with my schedule (8 AM lol) + I can self study the concepts for 189 later. 

I want to take a technical elective or just a useful class like full stack decal or something. Info 159 would have been perfect but they don't offer it in the Fall. Is cog sci 131 a useful class? Would Data 100 be too much work?

Any other classes that are worth looking at? Thanks!
history.subject: Recommendations for useful technical classes
